dt.t: felt that the candidate's {wi}density{/wi} on the subject of equality was alarming

dt: {bc}the quantity per unit of volume {dx_def}see {dxt|volume:1||2}{/dx_def}, unit of area {dx_def}see {dxt|area||1}{/dx_def}, or unit of length: such as
{bc}the mass {dx_def}see {dxt|mass:2||1c}{/dx_def} of a substance per unit of volume

dt.t: pure iron has a {wi}density{/wi} of 7.8 grams per cubic centimeter

dt: {bc}the distribution of a quantity (such as electricity or energy) per unit usually of space (such as length, area, or volume)

dt.t: The drawback to using ethanol as a complete replacement for gasoline, however, is not only the high cost of its production from cellulose but also its lower energy {wi}density{/wi}.

dt: {bc}the average number of individuals or units per unit of space

dt.t: a population {wi}density{/wi} of 500 per square mile
a housing {wi}density{/wi} of 10 houses per acre

dt: {bc}the degree of opacity {dx_def}see {dxt|opacity||2}{/dx_def} of a {d_link|translucent|translucent} medium

shortdef: the quality or state of being dense
the quantity per unit of volume, unit of area, or unit of length: such as
the mass of a substance per unit of volume

dt: {bc}a particular value of a probability density function

shortdef: probability density function; also : a particular value of a probability density function
